intro: Thereianthus spicatus, commonly known as the spike-headed thereianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Thereianthus spicatus is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
